title: Finding out the pattern with Pascal's Triangle.
text: We know that the variables in this pattern will follow the pattern in Pascal's triangle. You should use the row of Pascal's triangle where the second number is $$4$$.
speech: We know that the variables in this pattern will follow the pattern in Pascal's triangle. You should use the row of Pascal's triangle where the second number is  4 .
pacedSpeech: We know that the variables in this pattern will follow the pattern in Pascal's triangle. You should use the row of Pascal's triangle where the second number is   4

title: Finding out the coefficients.
text: The coefficients according to Pascal's triangle are $$1$$, $$4$$, $$6$$, $$4$$, $$1$$.
speech: The coefficients according to Pascal's triangle are  1 ,  4 ,  6 ,  4 ,  1 .
pacedSpeech: The coefficients according to Pascal's triangle are   1

title: Expanding the polynomial.
text: Use the formula: $${\left(a+b\right)}^n$$ $$=$$ $$a^n$$ + $$___$$ $$a^n-1b^1$$ + $$___$$ $$a^n-2b^2$$ +... + $$___$$ $$a^1 b^n-1$$ + $$b^n$$ and fill in the blanks with the values from Pascal's triangle.
speech: Use the formula:  parentheses a plus b,  to the n-th   is equal to   a to the n-th  +  blank   a to the n-th minus 1 b to the first,  +  blank   a to the n-th minus 2 b squared,  +... +  blank  , a to the first b to the n-th minus, 1  +  b to the n-th  and fill in the blanks with the values from Pascal's triangle.
pacedSpeech: Use the formula:    a plus b,  to the n-th
a to the n-th minus 1 b to the first,
a to the n-th minus 2 b squared,
, a to the first b to the n-th minus, 1
and fill in the blanks with the values from Pascal's triangle.

title: Plugging in the coefficients.
text: By plugging in the coefficients found earlier, we get $$x^4+4x^3 y^1+6x^2 y^2+4x^1 y^3+y^4$$.
speech: By plugging in the coefficients found earlier, we get  x to the fourth plus, 4 x cubed y to the first plus, 6 x squared y squared plus, 4 x to the first y cubed plus y to the fourth .
pacedSpeech: By plugging in the coefficients found earlier, we get   x to the fourth plus, 4 x cubed y to the first plus, 6 x squared y squared plus, 4 x to the first y cubed plus y to the fourth
